physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of four individuals
 seated around a small table. There are two men and two women. They are all posing and smiling towards the camera. On the table
 there are several empty plates and half-filled glasses. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

subject_terms_4:
sgcool_label_text:This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life
 including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a group of four individuals, seated around a small table. There are two men and two women. They are all posing and smiling towards the camera. On the table, there are several empty plates and half-filled glasses. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
